content:
With your car's fuel economy and road trip distance, I can give you a more accurate estimate.

**Step 1: Current fuel economy** = 28 mpg
**Step 2: Adjusted fuel economy** = 28 + 1.5 = 29.5 mpg (accounting for the maintenance boost)
**Step 3: Road trip distance** = 240 miles
**Step 4: Gas consumption** = 240 miles ÷ 29.5 mpg ≈ 8.1 gallons of gas

So, for your 240-mile road trip, you can expect to use approximately 8.1 gallons of gas.

To be on the safe side, you might want to add 1-2 gallons to your estimate, depending on your driving habits and any potential detours or stops along the way. This will give you a buffer in case you need to fill up before reaching your destination.

Based on this estimate, you can plan your fuel stops and budget accordingly. Enjoy your road trip!
